titleInfo.title: Hill v. Village of Loomis, Nebraska
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant filed by Roger Shiffermiller, Patrick Cooper, and Fraser Stryker PC, LLO, (filing no. 16), is granted. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (GJG)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:09-cv-03061; Hill v. Village of Loomis, Nebraska;

extension.docketText: ORDER - The motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant filed by Roger Shiffermiller, Patrick Cooper, and Fraser Stryker PC, LLO, (filing no. 16), is granted. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (GJG)

titleInfo.title: Hill v. Village of Loomis, Nebraska
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 19 Motion to Strike. The defendant's jury demand was due on June 4, 2009. It was untimely filed on June 5, 2009. The plaintiffs motion strike the defendant's jury demand as untimely, (filing no. 19), will be granted. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:09-cv-03061; Hill v. Village of Loomis, Nebraska;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 19 Motion to Strike. The defendant's jury demand was due on June 4, 2009. It was untimely filed on June 5, 2009. The plaintiffs motion strike the defendant's jury demand as untimely, (filing no. 19), will be granted. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: Hill v. Village of Loomis, Nebraska
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - With the agreement of Judge Piester, the Chief Judge and the other district judges, Judge Kopf has begun handling all magistrate matters previously handled by Judge Piester. As to those cases listed, unless a party files a motion to request a telephonic planning conference on or before July 10, 2009, no planning conference will be held to discuss the scheduling of the case to trial, and a final progression order will be entered based on the representations set forth in the parties' Rule 26(f) Report. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (LKH)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:09-cv-03061; Hill v. Village of Loomis, Nebraska;

As to those cases listed, unless a party files a motion to request a telephonic planning conference on or before July 10, 2009, no planning conference will be held to discuss the scheduling of the case to trial, and a final progression order will be entered based on the representations set forth in the parties' Rule 26(f) Report. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (LKH)

titleInfo.title: Hill v. Village of Loomis, Nebraska
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER. It is ordered that: (1)The following matter previously scheduled before the undersigned is herewith referred to Judge Zwart, to wit,(A)Nature of hearing:Pretrial conference.(B)Date and time of hearing: Thursday, September 16, 2010, at 11:00 a.m.(C)Place of hearing: Judge Zwart's chambers, Room 566, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall, North, Lincoln, Nebraska.(2)Judge Zwart will issue a report and recommendation or order as is appropriate. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )
